questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 20 cm and a width of 12 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = length × width = 20 × 12 = 240 cm²

questions.question: The perimeter of a square is 60 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Side length = perimeter ÷ 4 = 60 ÷ 4 = 15 cm. Area = side² = 15 × 15 = 225 cm²

questions.question: A circle has a diameter of 14 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Radius = diameter ÷ 2 = 14 ÷ 2 = 7 cm. Area = πr² = (22/7) × 7 × 7 = 154 cm²

questions.question: The area of a regular hexagon is 150 square centimeters. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: Area of regular hexagon = (3√3/2) × side². Therefore, side² = (2 × 150) ÷ (3√3) ≈ 49. Therefore, side = √49 = 7 cm

questions.question: A triangle has a base of 10 cm and a height of 8 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 10 × 8 = 40 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 180 square meters and its width is 12 meters. What is its length?
questions.explanation: Length = area ÷ width = 180 ÷ 12 = 15 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 9 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 2 × 3.14 × 9 = 56.2 cm

questions.question: The area of a parallelogram is 84 square centimeters and its base is 12 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Height = area ÷ base = 84 ÷ 12 = 7 cm

questions.question: A square has an area of 256 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Side length = √256 = 16 cm. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 16 = 64 cm

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 135 square meters. Its parallel sides are 15 meters and 30 meters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 135) ÷ (15 + 30) = 270 ÷ 45 = 6 meters

questions.question: A regular pentagon has a perimeter of 50 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular pentagon, all sides are equal. Side length = perimeter ÷ 5 = 50 ÷ 5 = 10 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 66 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 66. Therefore, r = 66 ÷ (2 × 22/7) = 10.5 cm. Area = πr² = (22/7) × 10.5 × 10.5 = 345 cm²

questions.question: A rectangle has a perimeter of 50 cm and a length of 15 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2(length + width). Therefore, width = (50 ÷ 2) - 15 = 10 cm. Area = length × width = 15 × 10 = 150 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rhombus is 72 square centimeters and one of its diagonals is 12 centimeters. What is the length of the other diagonal?
questions.explanation: Area of rhombus = (1/2) × product of diagonals. Therefore, other diagonal = (2 × area) ÷ given diagonal = (2 × 72) ÷ 12 = 12 cm

questions.question: A circle has an area of 314 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 314. Therefore, r² = 314 ÷ 3.14 = 100. Therefore, r = √100 = 10 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a rectangle is 42 cm and its area is 110 square centimeters. What are its dimensions?
questions.explanation: Let length = l and width = w. Then 2(l + w) = 42 and l × w = 110. Solving these equations gives l = 11 cm and w = 10 cm

questions.question: A regular octagon has a perimeter of 72 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular octagon, all sides are equal. Side length = perimeter ÷ 8 = 72 ÷ 8 = 9 cm

questions.question: The area of a triangle is 36 square centimeters and its height is 8 centimeters. What is its base?
questions.explanation: Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height. Therefore, base = (2 × area) ÷ height = (2 × 36) ÷ 8 = 9 cm

questions.question: A square and a rectangle have the same area. The rectangle has length 20 cm and width 5 cm. What is the perimeter of the square?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = 20 × 5 = 100 cm². Side of square = √100 = 10 cm. Perimeter of square = 4 × 10 = 40 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 50.24 cm. What is its diameter? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = π × diameter. Therefore, diameter = circumference ÷ π = 50.24 ÷ 3.14 = 16 cm

questions.question: A parallelogram has a base of 15 cm and a height of 10 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of parallelogram = base × height = 15 × 10 = 150 cm²

questions.question: The area of a circle is 113.04 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 113.04. Therefore, r² = 113.04 ÷ 3.14 = 36. Therefore, r = √36 = 6 cm

questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 18 cm and an area of 162 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 162 ÷ 18 = 9 cm. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(18 + 9) = 54 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a square is 52 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Side length = perimeter ÷ 4 = 52 ÷ 4 = 13 cm. Area = side² = 13 × 13 = 169 cm²

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 7 cm, 24 cm, and 25 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (7-24-25). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 7 × 24 = 84 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 144 square meters and its width is 9 meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Length = area ÷ width = 144 ÷ 9 = 16 meters. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(16 + 9) = 50 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 8 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 2 × 3.14 × 8 = 50.2 cm

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 120 square centimeters. Its parallel sides are 15 centimeters and 25 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 120) ÷ (15 + 25) = 240 ÷ 40 = 6 cm

questions.question: A square has an area of 225 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Side length = √225 = 15 cm. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 15 = 60 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 69.08 cm. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 69.08. Therefore, r = 69.08 ÷ (2 × 3.14) = 11 cm
